intro: Tarenna valida, commonly known as the Madagascan tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, Tarenna valida is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
